Class Date

java.lang.Object
util.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
Represents a date with methods for validation and comparison. This class implements Comparable util.Date to allow comparison of date instances.

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Validates if the current date is a valid calendar date.
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid; false otherwise.

    • isLeap

      private boolean isLeap(int year)
      Determines if the specified year is a leap year.
      Parameters:
      year - The year to check.
      Returns:
      true if the year is a leap year; false otherwise.

    • today

      public static Date today()
      Returns a util.Date instance representing today's date.
      Returns:
      A util.Date object representing the current date.

    • isNotTodayOrBefore

      public boolean isNotTodayOrBefore()
      Checks if the current date is not today or is in the future.
      Returns:
      true if the date is after today; false otherwise.

    • isTodayOrAfter

      public boolean isTodayOrAfter()
      Checks if the current date is today or in the future.
      Returns:
      true if the date is today or after; false otherwise.

    • isWeekend

      public boolean isWeekend()
      Checks if the current date falls on a weekend (Saturday or Sunday).
      Returns:
      true if the date is a weekend; false otherwise.

    • isWithin6Months

      public boolean isWithin6Months()
      Checks if the current date is within six months from today.
      Returns:
      true if the date is within six months; false otherwise.
